review.body: Disappointing book. Had so much potential, but it was just a chore to read. Great concept, great setting, so many great ideas. But just really dull and laboured. I really wanted to like this book, but I just couldn't.

book.title: Tailing a Tabby (A Bookmobile Cat Mystery, #2)

review.body: Loved this second book in the series. I find Minnie so sweet and refreshing, and LOVE the way she interacts with Eddie. I won't give the story away, but just love how upbeat and positive Minnie always tries to be. There's a real honesty about these books. Can't wait to read #3!

book.title: Someone You Know: Part One (DS Lucy Black, #2)

review.body: Life in the Cascade Mountains with a local newspaper editor and her staff. A murder to spice things up

book.title: Change of Plans (Crime and Passion Book 2)

review.body: “Change of Plans” is an incredibly touching, sad, yet inspiring story of a young woman fighting a terminal illness, and in her selflessness trying to do the last good deed for the sake of her husband and family – find them a new wife and a mother. Genna’s courage in the story was indeed worth adm...
Loved this book! Difficult to put down, sometimes a bit slow and on occasion I wanted to slap some common sence into the main character, written beautifully though.

Good Start to a story but there is very little conflict and what there is is summed up in like 2 chapters. Really would have liked to seen this drawn out a little more but would read the next in line for sure.

book.title: Mary Anne Saves the Day (Baby-Sitters Club Graphic Novels #3)

review.body: Awwww! Thank you, Raina Telgemeier for bringing the BSC back to life in graphic novel form. Still as good a series as I remembered <3

book.title: Journey to the Volcano Palace (The Secrets of Droon, #2)

review.body: They're simple little books, but they're such a great adventure. I read these when I was growing up and even now, reading it as someone who's almost 25, the world and the ideas floating around in the background are really fantastic. Like seriously, what other book can you name that puts a mermaid...

book.title: The Old Man and His God: Discovering the Spirit of India

review.body: Mmmm...This lady has written her own perceptions and experiences. Mostly swirling around 'Infosys' and it's organizing activities. Each having their own perception. Not so different !! Once simply can read.

book.title: Summer at Little Beach Street Bakery (Little Beach Street Bakery, #2)

review.body:
Delightful. Delectable. Heartwarming. Summer at Little Beach Street Bakery is a wonderful look at one woman’s life on a small island and all the fun, drama, and craziness that comes with it.

This is the story of Polly Waterford. She is a baker in a small island off the coast of England. Her work i...

The book starts slow and keeps a steady pace. We are transported into the 60's in Hazard, Kentucky and follow the budding romance of Owen and Sarah. That's all it is, really. One normal event after another brings them together or apart. The author teases you with shape shifting and that there are...

book.title: Batman: A Death in the Family

review.body: I find the concept of letting the readers decide whether a character lives or dies quite a strange one but in this case I think it actually worked quite well. This graphic novel provides very interesting backgrounds for a couple of the Robins and I enjoyed reading about how not all of the Robins...

book.title: Home Grown: Adventures in Parenting off the Beaten Path, Unschooling, and Reconnecting with the Natural World

review.body: This book is excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed reading it. The author's rich descriptions are so wonderful, I had to read them twice. I can relate to his sense of place and identity with the land, it is just terrific that he can capture the feeling so accurately with his chosen words.

Love the book, great concept, great song, great at keeping the attention of a room full of toddlers.

Cons: About three pages too long.
A book that will have you on the edge of your seat and questioning how pointless your 'Natural' is.

book.title: Harley Quinn, Vol. 1: Hot in the City

review.body: Harley Quinn is my all-time favourite Batman villain so I was very excited to receive this as a present. I enjoyed reading a book where she was the main character and I liked reading about her softer side and friendship with Ivy. Looking forward to reading volume two and I loved the artwork.
This was a great read really enjoyed it
